apidoc:summary.p: The Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) API module contains functions that allow you to write scripts to configure EC2.
EC2 is installed as the following file:
where install_dir is the directory in which MarkLogic Server is installed.
To use the ec2-2009-11-30.xqy module in your own XQuery modules, include the following line in your XQuery prolog:
The library uses the ec2: namespace, which is not predefined in the server.
MarkLogic recommends enabling the URI Lexicon when using EC2; the URI lexicon will improve performance, especially when the database grows to a large number of documents.

apidoc:function.name: describe-images
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DescribeImages function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the ImageId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the ExecutableBy parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Owner parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: describe-availability-zones
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DescribeAvailabilityZones function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the ZoneName parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: describe-regions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DescribeRegions function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the RegionName.n parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: attach-volume
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon AttachVolume function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the VolumeId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the InstanceId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Device parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: create-snapshot
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon CreateSnapshot function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the VolumeId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Description parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: create-volume
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon CreateVolume function without a SnapshotId parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the AvailabilityZone parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Size parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: create-volume-from-snapshot
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon CreateVolume function with a $snapshot-id parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the AvailabilityZone parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the SnapshotId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Size parameter on the Amazon function.

Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId parameter on the Amazon function.

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the VolumeId parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DescribeSnapshotAttribute function and passes createVolumePermission as the Attribute parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId.n parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DescribeSnapshots function.

Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId.n parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Owner parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the RestorableBy parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: describe-volumes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DescribeVolumes function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"

Sets the VolumeId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the InstanceId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Device parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Force parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: add-snapshot-create-volume-permission-users
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon ModifySnapshotAttribute function and passes the IDs of the users to be given permission to create the snapshot. This function sets add as the OperationType parameter and createVolumePermission as the Attribute parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the UserId parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: add-snapshot-create-volume-permission-groups
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon ModifySnapshotAttribute function and passes the names of the groups to be given permission to create the snapshot. This function sets add as the OperationType parameter and createVolumePermission as the Attribute parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the UserGroup parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: remove-snapshot-create-volume-permission-users
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon ModifySnapshotAttribute function and passes the IDs of the users to be denied permission to create the snapshot. This function sets remove as the OperationType parameter and createVolumePermission as the Attribute parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the UserId parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: remove-snapshot-create-volume-permission-groups
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon ModifySnapshotAttribute function and passes the names of the groups to be denied permission to create the snapshot. This function sets remove as the OperationType parameter and createVolumePermission as the Attribute parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the SnapshotId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the UserGroup parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon ResetSnapshotAttribute function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"

apidoc:function.name: run-instances
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon RunInstances function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the ImageId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the MinCount parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the MaxCount parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the InstanceType parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the KeyName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the SecurityGroup.n parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the any number of optional parameters on the Amazon function. Specify using the form: ("name=value", "name=value").

apidoc:function.name: start-instances
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon StartInstances function.

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the InstanceId parameter on the Amazon function.

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the InstanceId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the Force parameter on the Amazon function.

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the InstanceId.n parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: authorize-group-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.UserId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: authorize-icmp-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress function and passes icmp as the IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the IpPermissions.n.FromPort parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the IpPermissions.n.ToPort parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the IpPermissions.n.IpRanges.m.CidrIp parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: authorize-tcp-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress function and passes tcp as the IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets both the IpPermissions.n.FromPort and IpPermissions.n.ToPort parameters on the Amazon function. Specify value as (FromPort, ToPort).
Sets the CidrIp parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: authorize-udp-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress function and passes udp as the IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets both the IpPermissions.n.FromPort and IpPermissions.n.ToPort parameters on the Amazon function. Specify value as (FromPort, ToPort).
Sets the CidrIp parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: create-security-group
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon CreateSecurityGroup function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the GroupDescription parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: delete-security-group
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon DeleteSecurityGroup function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: describe-security-groups

The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName.n parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: revoke-group-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon RevokeSecurityGroupIngress function and sets the UserId and GroupName parameters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the UserId parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: revoke-icmp-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon RevokeSecurityGroupIngress function, passes icmp as the IpProtocol parameter, and sets the FromPort, ToPort, and CidrIp parameters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the FromPort parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the ToPort parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets the CidrIp parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: revoke-tcp-ingress
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function calls the Amazon RevokeSecurityGroupIngress function, passes tcp as the IpProtocol parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Your Amazon Access Key ID obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets both the FromPort and ToPort parametersr on the Amazon function. Specify value as (FromPort, ToPort).
Sets the CidrIp parameter on the Amazon function.

apidoc:function.name: revoke-udp-ingress

Your Amazon Secret Access Key obtained from your account's Security Credentials.
The EC2 region you wish to manage. Determines the web service endpoint to be used. Example: "us-east-1"
Sets the GroupName parameter on the Amazon function.
Sets both the FromPort and ToPort parameters on the Amazon function. Specify value as (FromPort, ToPort).
Sets the CidrIp parameter on the Amazon function.
